page.title: 12Industry
page.content: kesgrae Quary, an area of approx 90 acres 22/46, 23/46 commenced operations mid 1950s and consissts of Hall Aggreate Ltd's gravel workings, a transpot work-shop and an asphalt plant, excavating 100,000 tonnes a year, mainly sand for building and some hoggin type material used for road bases. The present owner of Bealings Railway Station keeps his vans, which provide an express delivery service to London, in the yard. Propane and butane gas cylinders are stored in the open in the yard, and a firm of civil and construction consulting engineering consultants also uses the station building. In Rushmere Street an old barn has een adapted by a craftsman to make wrought iron items such as garden gates, fire-irons and decorative items.
